SENT.plain: Mongolian gerbils were subjected to bilateral carotid artery occlusion, exposed to nesting material and examined daily
Five minutes of ischemia significantly reduced nesting behavior for 3 days; while 10 min attenuated nesting 6 days
Semi-novel re-exposure to nesting material also resulted in deficits
These disruptions in nesting behavior directly correlate to the amount of ischemic morphological damage and thus serve as a behavioral indicator of tissue damage
